intro: Aciotis discolor, commonly known as the whiteleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, silver-green leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Aciotis discolor is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
